turns.content: what's an interesting Welsh myth that would make a good painting?

One interesting Welsh myth that could make a good painting is the story of Blodeuwedd. Blodeuwedd is a woman made out of flowers by the wizard Gwydion to be the wife of Lleu Llaw Gyffes. However, she falls in love with another man and plots to kill her husband. As punishment, she is turned into an owl and is doomed to spend eternity alone in the night sky. The imagery of a woman made of flowers and her transformation into an owl could make for a striking and unique painting.

Another interesting Welsh myth that could make for a good painting is the story of Afagddu, also known as the "most ugly man." According to legend, Afagddu was born so hideously ugly that his mother died of shock upon seeing him. Despite his appearance, he was a powerful druid and poet, and was able to see the beauty in the world that others could not. A painting depicting Afagddu, showcasing his inner beauty and wisdom, despite his physical appearance, could be a powerful and thought-provoking piece of art.

Another Welsh myth that would make an interesting painting is the story of Bran the Blessed. Bran was a giant and a king of Britain, who possessed a magical cauldron that had the power to revive the dead. He and his followers sailed to Ireland in a giant ship, but Bran was killed in battle. His head was cut off and buried under the White Mount, in London, with the instructions that it should face towards France, so it could continue to protect Britain. It is said that as long as the head remained, Britain would be safe from invasion. A painting depicting Bran and his ship, with his head buried in the background, could be a powerful and evocative image.

1. The story of Lleu Llaw Gyffes is another interesting Welsh myth that could make for a good painting. Lleu is a god of light and a skilled warrior, who was betrayed by his wife and his uncle. He was able to avenge himself and his story is a reminder of the importance of loyalty and honor.
2. The story of Taliesin is a Welsh myth about a legendary poet and bard. He is considered one of the greatest poets of the Middle Ages, and is associated with King Arthur's court. A painting depicting Taliesin composing poetry or singing in front of the court could be a beautiful and evocative image.
3. The story of Gwyn ap Nudd is a Welsh myth about the king of the fairies and the ruler of the underworld. He is often depicted as a fierce warrior and a hunter, and is associated with the hunt of the Wild Hunt. A painting depicting Gwyn and his hunt could be a beautiful and powerful image.
4. The story of Rhiannon is a Welsh myth about a goddess of fertility and sovereignty. She is known for her beauty and her wisdom, and is often depicted as a horse-riding queen. A painting depicting Rhiannon on horseback, surrounded by nature, could be a beautiful and evocative image.
5. The story of the Mabinogion is a collection of Welsh myths and legends that tell the stories of ancient heroes, gods and goddesses, and magical creatures. A painting that illustrates one of the many tales from the Mabinogion such as "The Lady of the Fountain" or "Branwen Daughter of Llyr" could be a beautiful and intriguing image that tells a rich story.
